thread.title: Silvanic fills in admirably under center
thread.title_full: Silvanic fills in admirably under center

title: Silvanic fills in admirably under center
text:
Silvanic fills in admirably under center 
By wbng sports October 12, 2015 Updated Oct 12, 2015 at 10:21 PM EDT 
Newark Valley, NY (WBNG Binghamton) This season, one of the stars on a team full of them has been Chenango Forks quarterback LJ Watson. in the Blue Devils' biggest game to date this year, Watson got hurt against Newark Valley. 
Enter Tony Silvanic. 
Silvanic played his part well in relief of Watson, leading the Blue Devils on some long second half drives to help put the game away and win 34-21. 
In the process, the Blue Devils (5-1) clinched their division in Class C. 
The performance impressed his coach, who now knows if his No.1 option behind center goes down, the offense is still in capable hands with Silvanic. 
"How often do we practice with Tony at quarterback?" head coach Dave Hogan remarked after the game. "It's not much. He seemed to get better as the half went on." 
"I just told the line to keep doing what they were doing and I would get the job done," Silvanic said. "We're all about stepping up when we need to and today was my turn. Once again, it was just the line killing it up front." To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required.
